text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Main economic indicators according to Finance Ministry show consolidation of resumed economic take-off, strong slowdown in inflation and a better foreign trade situation. Figures are for the first half of 1997.
- Bank staff union reaches agreement with Credit Agricole on urgent points, with others to be discussed in September.
- One household in four would be prepared to contribute to paying for primary schooling for its children, according to report by National Council for Youth and the Future.
- Morocco reiterates its attachment to the integrity and unity of the Comoros islands.
- Total of 37 people now been charged or brought before court over cocaine washed up on Moroccan beaches.
- Court sentences man to six years' jail for rape of 17-month-old baby.
